titleStmt.title: William Spears and James McGough v King County. Information.

bibl.title: William Spears and James McGough v King County. Information.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: In Justice's Court, Before Thomas H. Cann, Justice of the Peace in and for Seattle Precinct.
Territory of Washington, County of King.| ss.
div1.p: Bernard McCronney being first duly sworn, says that at Seattle in said King County, on the twenty sixth day of October 1883 William Spears and James McGough did commit the crime of obtaining money by false pretenses as follows:

By then and there being did on the 26th day of October 1883 designedly, wilfully, fullknowingly and falsely pretend to the said complaintant that there was a certain tract of land about six miles from the city of Seattle which could be entrusted as public land by the said complaintant and which had and before that time unfiled upon by anyone, and function move states to the said Complaintant that if the said Complaintaint would give to them the said William Spears and James McGough the sum of one hundred dollars that they would inform him contrary to the form of the Statute in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the Territory of Washington. Subscribed and sworn to before me this, the day of _____ 188 ours Justice of the Peace Seattle Precinct.
div1.ab: Filed Nov 2 1883 TH Cann Justice of the Peace, Seattle Precinct King County, WT
